alert.note: Alert for Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 19 at 8:39AM CST until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Niobrara River near Sparks affecting Cherry County. .An ice jam will cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. Rapid fluctuations in the river level are possible over the next few days due to the ice in the river. For the Niobrara River...including Sparks...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Niobrara River near Sparks. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along the lower banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CST Friday /7:15 AM MST Friday/ the stage was 5.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon and continue rising to 6.0 feet this afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 07/01/1962. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Niobrara River Sparks 6.0 5.1 Fri 8 am CST 6.0 6.0 6.0 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CST /745 PM MST/.
